Module com.example.navalbattleminiproject3
Package com.example.navalbattleminiproject3.model.board.GamePieces

Class Boats

java.lang.Object
com.example.navalbattleminiproject3.model.board.GamePieces.Boats
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Boats extends Object implements Serializable
Class representing a boat in the game, including its type, location, and damaged parts. Provides methods to manage the boat's condition, including damage and destruction. This class is used to manage boat objects in the game.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Boats

      public Boats()
      Default constructor that initializes a boat of type 1 with no damage and no direction. It also initializes the boat's location and damage tracking lists.

    • Boats

      public Boats(int boatType, int boatDirection, String[] positionList)
      Constructor that initializes a boat with a specific type, direction, and location based on provided positions.
      Parameters:
      boatType - the type of the boat (e.g., 1, 2, 3, etc.)
      boatDirection - the direction of the boat (0: right, 1: up, 2: left, 3: down)
      positionList - an array of strings representing the positions of the boat parts.

    • getBoatDestroyed

      public boolean getBoatDestroyed()
      Gets whether the boat is destroyed.
      Returns:
      true if the boat is destroyed, false otherwise.

    • isBoatDestroyed

      public boolean isBoatDestroyed()
      Checks if the boat is destroyed by verifying if all its parts are damaged.
      Returns:
      true if the boat is destroyed, false otherwise.

    • destroyBoatParts

      public void destroyBoatParts(int row, int column)
      Damages a specific part of the boat at the given row and column. If the part does not exist, throws an exception.
      Parameters:
      row - the row of the part to damage.
      column - the column of the part to damage.
